key_risks: Cybersecurity vulnerabilities, including a significant ransomware attack and potential reputational damage
Dependence on public sector spending, making the company vulnerable to economic downturns and political shifts
Integration challenges from acquisitions, potentially affecting customer satisfaction and operational efficiency
Legal and ethical concerns, including lawsuits over overtime pay and software quality issues
controversies: Ransomware attack leading to a class-action lawsuit and potential financial liabilities
Legal disputes over breach of contract and overtime pay, resulting in a $3 million settlement
social_issues: Failure to pay overtime wages, impacting employee morale and labor practices
Complaints about software quality and performance from public sector clients
governance_issues: Challenges in integrating acquired companies and maintaining service quality
Ongoing legal disputes and potential financial liabilities

sources.title: The Tyler Technology Ransomware Attack Overview - Heimdal Security
sources.snippet: The Tyler Technologies ransomware attack happened on September 23 when the threat actors breached the network of the company and managed to deploy the malware. In response, the company acted quickly and notified law enforcement, whilst also hiring a forensics firm to investigate the incident and discover the extent of the situation.
